videoSnippet.title: Worst Position in Chess History || Giri vs Meshkovs || PRO Chess League (2020)
videoSnippet.description:
Follow me on Instagram for extra content https://www.instagram.com/agadmator/

Anish Giri vs Nikita Meshkovs
ProChess League
26.2.2020.
Queen's Indian, Yates variation (E16)

1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. g3 Bb7 5. Bg2 Bb4+ 6. Bd2 a5 7. O-O O-O 8. Bf4 Be7 9. Qc2 Be4 10. Qc1 Bb7 11. Nc3 Ne4 12. Nb5 c6 13. Nc3 Nxc3 14. Qxc3 d6 15. e4 Nd7 16. Rad1 b5 17. c5 Nf6 18. Qc2 d5 19. e5 Ne8 20. h4 b4 21. Ng5 g6 22. Nf3 Ba6 23. Rfe1 Ng7 24. Bh6 Ra7 25. Qd2 Re8 26. g4 Bc8 27. Bh3 Kh8 28. Bg5 Rg8 29. Qf4 Qf8 30. Bf6 Rb7 31. Bf1 Bxf6 32. exf6 Ne8 33. Ne5 Rc7 34. g5 Bb7 35. a3 Ba8 36. axb4 axb4 37. Ra1 Bb7 38. Ra7 h5 39. Rea1 Kh7 40. R1a4 b3 41. Rb4 Bc8 42. Ra8 Rh8 43. Rbb8 Rb7 44. Rxc

1. Each team has a roster of 8 to 16 players. 4 of these players will be chosen to compete in each league match.
2. Each team can have no more than 5 players rated above 2700 on their roster.
3. Each team can have no more than 10 players rated above 2600 on their roster.
4. The PRO Chess Season uses the most recent December FIDE Rating List.
5. You can add a player to your roster at any time during the season.
​6. You may add more than 16 players, however every extra player above 16 will cost your team a half point in the standings.

Read more here https://www.prochessleague.com/rules-new.html
